body:
/kind bug

**What happened**:
The test image pets/zookeeper-installer references an old alpha version of zookeeper:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/3abb9f0ad7fd27a52679e395e73a62bebefea6fe/test/images/pets/zookeeper-installer/Dockerfile#L28-L29

This can't be built anymore, as it no longer exists on the server:
```
Step 5/8 : RUN wget -q -O /zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha.tar.gz http://apache.mirrors.pair.com/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha/zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha.tar.gz &&     tar -xzf /zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha.tar.gz -C /tmp/ && mv /tmp/zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha /zookeeper && rm /zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha.tar.gz
 ---> Running in 944c505aef1f
The command '/bin/sh -c wget -q -O /zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha.tar.gz http://apache.mirrors.pair.com/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha/zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha.tar.gz &&     tar -xzf /zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha.tar.gz -C /tmp/ && mv /tmp/zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha /zookeeper && rm /zookeeper-3.5.0-alpha.tar.gz' returned a non-zero code: 8
```

Sure enough, http://apache.mirrors.pair.com/zookeeper/ now lists beta versions for 3.5.x, as well as stable 3.4.x versions, but no 3.5.0 alphas.

We probably should update this to a newer version, or alternately delete the test and image if it's no longer providing signal.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
`make -C test/images WHAT=pets/zookeeper-installer`

/sig apps

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Apps.
labels.name: sig/apps

title: gcr.io/kubernetes-e2e-test-images/pets/zookeeper-installer can't be built
